adjective.description: Situated at the greatest distance from a specified or understood point.
examples: the farthest door led to a kitchen

adverb.description: At or by the greatest distance (used to indicate how far one thing or person is or becomes distant from another)
examples: the bed farthest from the window

adverb.description: Over the greatest distance or area.
examples: his group probably had farthest to ride

phrases: the Allied line had been pushed forward, at the farthest, about one mile
origin: Late Middle English: formed as a superlative of further.
